description: Indulge in this creamy sweet potato casserole topped with crunchy pecans! Made with fresh sweet potatoes, brown sugar, and a hint of vanilla, it's perfect for holiday gatherings or family dinners. Save this recipe for a comforting side dish that everyone will love! üç†
ingredients: 4 cups sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: In a large pot, boil sweet potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and mash until smooth.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed sweet potatoes, brown sugar, milk, melted butter, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Mix until well combined.
Transfer the sweet potato mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
In another bowl, mix chopped pecans, flour, and granulated sugar. Sprinkle this topping evenly over the sweet potato mixture.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the casserole is bubbling.
tips: For the perfect sweet potato casserole, ensure your sweet potatoes are fully cooked before mashing to achieve a creamy texture. Use fresh pecans for the topping; toasting them lightly before adding enhances their flavor. Avoid overmixing the sweet potato mixture to keep it light and fluffy. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in the oven at 350¬∞F (175¬∞C) until warmed through, about 15-20 minutes.
